content.label: "Sweet", "touching", "melancholic", "other worldly"â€¦not words you usually associate with a video game, but playing Incoboto gave me those reactions. If you felt for Wall-E, a little robot alone on a deserted world and hoped the little guy might have a better life, you should play the role of Inco, striving to find out what happened to his world, his people, his civilization. You play the plunky, self-reliant Inco and discover what really happened, constantly striving to whatever end might be in store. The game is wonderful, a marvelous, mysterious, and mesmerizing blend of action, adventure and brain-teasing puzzle solving. The game uses 2D platforming interface, yet feels far more three-dimensional than most 3D first-person games I've played. There is a real sense of suspense, danger conspiracy, and sometimes even dread, without the violence found in most games. The game has fantastic visuals, special effects, music and sound effects that all blend perfectly to enhance the experience. I was happy with the ending, but sad I had to leave. Play Incoboto and support innovative game design, maybe there is more to gaming than throwing birds around.

title.label: Please stop prompting me for twitter and open feint!

content.label: Fun, non-twitchy, unique and very pretty platformer, but one star off for constantly nagging me about social features. Please make it stop!

I am very frustrated! There are no instructions to get you started. I did finally figure out some ways to go forward. But, after reaching the third planetary group, I cannot get any further. The game just recycles me back to the beginning or the second stage over and over. Not fun!

Played this on and off for a week and it's a very well done iPad game. Simple controls, lots of tough puzzles and a focused, linear story make it an epic iPad game. And it was developed entirely by one guy!
This seems like a good game but the controls are just horrible, if they just made a jump button it would be awesome but until then I only give two dead stars

Great mix of platformer and puzzle game, very smooth learning/difficulty curve, and quite a nice gameplay experience too. 

I can understand the default controls, but I personally would prefer left/right controls and a single jump/shoot buttons, rather than the current dual left/right button alternative to the default. It's nice and intuitive to basically trace your way through the game with one finger, but it sometimes gets in the way of seeing what you're doing.

Otherwise it is just a great game altogether!

This game is so fun!! Buy it now! I remember seeing the "Space Alone" video by Ilias Sounas, and before I knew that this was inspired by it, I thought to myself "This reminds me of that sad video where the little alien is all alone in space." so, look up the video if you haven't also. :)

Really well done. Beautiful artwork and audio. Interesting storyline reminiscent of World Of Goo (the vaguely sinister but otherwise nebulous Corporation and their passive-aggressive messages and melancholy feel) and puzzles that were challenging but not frustrating. I found the controls to be challenging at times, for example trying to move a step causes Inco to jump. It also asks for Twitter access every time you launch if you say "No."

Highly recommended.

title.label: Incboto: Worthy of a few kind words

content.label: Thoroughly enjoyable and well worth the coin. This game is chock full of challenges that will test your neurons. Kudos to the art director - the graphics are sublime (Fingers crossed for a sequel...) Enjoy!
Well worth your time if you like puzzle platformers. Nice (albeit melancholy) story and writing. The control scheme is a bit aggravating sometimes.
Average game. Probably won't open often

For my money this just perfect. A puzzler with platforming as well. This isn't the same old rehashed elements either--it really has some new and unique ideas. I've played lots of games, and I really have to say these are the kinds of games I look for. The developers really went the extra mile to include those little extra details: those hooks that make you want to keep playing. The aesthetic somewhat reminds me of World of Goo, while the gameplay is similar to an obscure Wii title called Fluidity (which is a one-of-a-kind game in its own right). I think I can comfortably call this a Metroidvania title, for those of you who also know WAAY too much about video games. To the developers-- thanks for going the extra mile. I wouldn't have written this review had your hard work not been so obvious.

This game is amazing on so many levels! Hats off to the developer. I heard it's been developed by one guy..so more kudos for that. I'd come home from work for days anxious to do nothing but play!! We demand a part 2 :)

title.label: Amazing... until a huge glitch ruined the end.

content.label:
I freaking loved the crap out of this game! Played it all in almost one sitting, and then... the "end."

I gathered all of the star pieces and then instead of powering on the gateway, I went back to the beginning to look for the rest of the star charts. When I got back to the home world, roll the credits, talking about these warm suns returning, but all it showed were black holes...?!

THEN, I reset the app, went to the gateway, and the ending this time was just Inco sitting on a rooftop, forever, infinite loop. HELP! I WANT MY ENDING!
Well polished game great for people of all ages.
This game is absolutely wonderful. The controls are fantastic too. I can't believe it was made by one person.
A fun game where you travel to find a way to bring back the suns. good gameplay for a good price. First!!! :)

This is an adventure and puzzle game which is at once beautiful, ominous and mysterious.  The visuals and sounds are wonderful and atmospheric.  The controls and interface are equally great.  By far, this is my favorite game of it's type that I have enjoyed on my iPad.  This is not to be missed!
Best game ever!the graphics are great and the storyline is perfectly crafted. Love this game if there is anyone out there who haven't bought this game yet they DEFINATLY should.

This game is a symbol of both form and content.  A game that is as beautiful as it is challenging. Great storyline, visually stunning, mind bending, and emotionally engaging.  Beyond that, it has a message that speaks to us all.  A wonderful blend of humor, sadness, and sympathy.

Thinking about buying this game?  Believe me, it is worth double its price... If not more.
Great game. Excellent mix of cute and dramatic. Oh and First!!!

At $2.99 this game is a great value. It takes cues from many different games. Take a bit of Super Mario galaxy, throw in the humor of portal, the platforming of metroid, and the style and music of Contre Jour. The corporation signs are of particular note. Very enjoyable! I look forward to more games from this developer.

I feel it is important to note that I am experiencing a lot of game crashes. Probably around 5 in the hour that I have played. Still a 5 star game though as I'm sure the developer will be making updates.
Clever.  Witty.  Adorable.  Beautiful.  Deep.  Profound.  Comical.  Timely.  Meaningful.  Challenging.  Enjoyable.  Purchase.  NOW!

title.label: I keep hoping this game will improve

content.label: ...but it's just really boring.
Fell in love with the game! Just finished it! :) hoped for an additional ending with all items collected though(

Stunning graphics, unique plot line, very engaging moment concept. Adorable characters, mind bending physics, futuristic sound track. Hauntingly strange clues and signs. Overall, WONDERFUL game. I cant help but fall in love with the sun, Helios, and it's bad English.

I rarely write reviews, but this is one of the best games I've played in a while on the iPad. It starts out seemingly simple, and gets more and more devilish (but with a good learning curve). I HIGHLY recommend it!
Reminds me a lot of Mario galaxy! I love the graphics, and the art is amazing.  Hope to see more games like this!
This is the best game I've played in months! Perfectly executed!
Great art work and awesome by only person I want to be a beta tester

title.label: Shines in a Galaxy Full of Adventure

content.label:
â€œIt fits like a gloveâ€ is something that canâ€™t often be said about video games and the many platforms out there.  Too many variables come into play that can tip the playing experience for better or for worse.  In the case of Incoboto by Fluttermindâ€™s Dene Carter, I couldnâ€™t imagine this amazing and unique game being more well-suited than it is on the iPad.  Most players will not only feel at with this beautiful puzzle adventure, theyâ€™ll have an equally wondrous time of discovery.

In the spirit of the Mayan prophecy, the theme in Incoboto is one of devastation and ultimately rebirth and takes the player through an unfolding storyline.  Journeying through a number of worlds each with its own dismal qualities, Inco is the little guy who leaves his own world to not only save other worlds but any of the surviving population.  Within the galaxy, all the suns have been extinguished except for one named Helios and the responsibility lies with Inco to feed him.

The journey takes place in a galaxy through 16 star systems each full of obstacles and puzzles that need to be solved in order to secure the life sourceâ€”Starpiecesâ€”Helios depends to stay bright.  Charming in nature, the environments and the soundtrack make Incoboto one of those games that will both relax and engage you.  

The intuitive touch controls take full advantage of the iPad and in general work remarkably well.  To move Inco, press the spot where you want to move him.  If you feel more comfortable, players can also switch to the directional keypad.  Another basic control is jumping which Inco will do plenty of and is as simple as tapping and sliding anywhere on the screen.  Inco can also carry and drop items which are designated during the game, and throwing is achieved by dragging a line from Inco toward the target and releasing.

Visually, Incoboto provides an eye appealing galaxy full of worlds waiting to be explored.  The obstacles are many with lots of depth and animation.  If youâ€™ve played Soosiz, youâ€™ll have a pretty good idea of what youâ€™re in for as you travel around each world.  

While Incoboto is a game, each planet is a microcosm of the issues we face in the real world.  The Corporation has destroyed the environment, and many of the issues that Inco faces have been created to prevent progress in addressing them.  Each level consists of several small planets that Inco travels and navigates between.   Players will initially use gravity beams and jetpacks and later on evolve into more tricky devices such as grappling hooks and teleports.

The puzzles themselves do require a bit of exploration and coordinated moves as the solutions arenâ€™t necessarily obvious or intuitive.  As with any platformer, thereâ€™s a plethora of moving parts, switches and items that unlock hidden areas and allow players to progress further.  Whether reachable by cranes or ledges, Starpieces are often located in less than easy to reach areas and often I found myself switching between the tap-to-move scheme to the directional keypad to improve movement accuracy.

The game feels linear in nature because Sungates open up once objectives are met within each level.  Thatâ€™s not necessarily a bad thing because youâ€™ll want to spend some time exploring the various worlds.  Youâ€™ll often come across an object such as a switch that is seemingly so out of reach and have you scratching your head.  The details are worth checking out simply because there are so many ways to interact with the environment.  And while many may want to rush through the game, Incoboto is one that should be savored.

Along the way, Inco is reminded of the Corporation via monitors activated by touch.  The messages can be ominous, and most serve as warnings of things to come.  The game feels balanced as the puzzles gradually become more difficult and test your logic and decision making skills.

Incoboto has GameCenter and OpenFeint support which provides for a variety of achievements.

Incobotoâ€™s satisfying experience is one that many will enjoy because it evokes that sense that while the galaxy may be large, everything is connected in some way.  That may sound strange to talk about a game in that sense, but once you start playing, â€œthereâ€™s no place like homeâ€ will likely ring true.
Save your money!!!! So not worth it!!!!!DUMB!!!!!

Been playing this for a few levels. All I can say is....WOW! A puzzle game with real puzzles. Well thought-out, truly puzzling puzzles. And a graphic style that puts most 'big boy' game companies to shame. Excellent work!

I've been following this game off and on for the past couple of months. It mainly grabbed my attention because of the cool art style but now that I've played a little I can say its very fun too and surprisingly deep. Not just another level after level of the same BS. Good story and lots of content to explore and learn more about the universe. Definitely get now while it's on sale. 

And oh yeah- FIRST!
